info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 3:23PM CDT until April 06 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON COUNTY... At 322 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bessemer, moving east at 35 mph. Quarter sized hail was reported with this storm in McCalla. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southern Birmingham, Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Bessemer, Homewood, Mountain Brook, Hueytown, Midfield, Brighton, Lipscomb, Bluff Park, Samford University, Splash Adventure, Cahaba Heights, Patton Creek, Ross Bridge, The Summit, Riverchase Galleria, Brook Highland and Promenade Tannehill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
